newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanon navy rescues 50 stranded Kurds.
newsitem.headline: Lebanon navy rescues 50 stranded Kurds.

text.p: The Lebanese navy on Tuesday rescued 50 Lebanon-based Iraqi Kurds who had been stranded without food for three days on a small island off northern Lebanon, security sources said.

The Kurds, who included women and children, said they had paid a Lebanese man to take them to Europe by boat but were instead dumped on Ramkeen island, a small nature reserve three km (two miles) off the northern port of Tripoli, the sources added.
Thousands of Kurds who fled Iraq and Turkey live in Lebanon.
